Job Title: Lead GMP Facility Coordinator

Location: North Carolina, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Manufacturing, Supply Chain

Description:
A leading life sciences manufacturing facility and Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) is expanding its operations. With recent investment exceeding $2b, the company is launching a large-scale biopharmaceutical manufacturing site in North Carolina.

This aims to strengthen the company's Bio-CDMO business, making it the largest end-to-end cell culture CDMO provider in the region.

The facility will offer comprehensive solutions, including drug substance manufacture, automated fill-finish, and packaging services. This expansion is the latest of several new initiatives undertaken to better position the company and it's services as a leader in contract manufacturing and development.

Your Role as Lead GMP Facility Coordinator:

Ensure adherence to current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) across all facility-driven support processes.Serve as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for facility-related GMP support, including gowning, pest control, and waste management.Oversee GMP contract vendors, ensuring protocols are executed accurately and efficiently.Manage deficiency escalations and communicate significant issues to relevant stakeholders.Develop and revise standard operating procedures (SOPs) to support operational excellence.Coordinate with departments such as Environmental Health & Safety and Quality to maintain compliance and safety standards.

Experience and Qualifications for the Lead GMP Facility Coordinator Role:

Experienced in GMP Facilities and/or Manufacturing.Proficient in Microsoft Office suite and Adobe, with strong technical writing skills.In-depth knowledge of building codes, FDA cGMP requirements, and systems including HVAC, plumbing, and electrical.Proven ability to influence, mentor, and develop sustainable practices.

Preferred Experience:Bachelor's degree in GMP Facilities Management or related field, with experience in budget management and capital projects.

Working Conditions & Physical Requirements:Must be able to engage in physical activities such as ascending/descending ladders and standing or sitting for prolonged periods.

This role offers a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the biopharmaceutical manufacturing sector, working with a team dedicated to making a real difference in a brand new area of investment for the firm. For immediate consideration, apply now. For more information or to explore similar opportunities within this sector, feel free to reach out directly.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
